title: Touching Computers: Creating Data Talismans
subtext: a workshop weaving digital and physical worlds
descriptionMd:
I made "[SIGIL I](https://spencer.place/creation/SIGIL-I/)" to be my first *webstone*, a handheld ceramic sculpture that holds my website. I carry my website around in my pocket and "give" my website to people I meet by tapping their phones with the talisman. But these stones aren’t just limited to holding websites. They can be infused with any digital media, from a message to a nostalgic image to a favorite song, and even programmed to take actions like sending messages to friends or joining a wifi network. These webstones can be molded (much like clay) in both form and function into intimate portals for their creators’ identities.
In this workshop, we’ll interweave the physical and digital worlds and create a clay computing sculptures using natural air-dry clay.  After, we'll explore how these "touching computers" can create a foundation for an intimate communal exchange. Attendees will leave with their own functional data talisman.
**Workshop History**
- (forthcoming) at **[Gray Area](http://grayarea.org/)** in San Francisco
- (forthcoming) September 2024 in New York
- 07/28/24 for **[Fidget Camp](https://fidgetcamp.com/)** in San Francisco
- 07/21/24 at **[Trust](https://trust.support/)** in Berlin
- 05/04/24 **ancient futures** at Stanford University in San Francisco
- 04/24/24 at **[madsci](https://www.madsci.io/)** in San Francisco
Contact me if you’d like to [invite me](https://spencer.place/collab#invite) to host it with you.
